recipe_ingredients: [{"recipe_ingredients":"1 tablespoon brown sugar"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 tablespoon Montreal steak seasoning"},{"recipe_ingredients":"2 teaspoons garlic powder"},{"recipe_ingredients":"2 teaspoons onion powder"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 (2 3/4 pound) tomahawk steak (3-inch thick bone-in ribeye)"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1/4 cup salted butter, at room temperature"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 tablespoon minced shallot"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 clove garlic, minced"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 tablespoon chopped fresh chives"},{"recipe_ingredients":"2 teaspoons reserved steak rub"}]
recipe_directions: [{"recipe_directions":"To make steak rub, place brown sugar, Montreal steak seasoning, garlic powder, and onion powder in a small airtight container; shake or stir to combine. Set aside 2 teaspoons steak rub to use in compound butter."},{"recipe_directions":"Place steak on a half sheet pan, and rub steak on top, bottom, and sides with remaining steak rub until well coated. Place steak, uncovered, in the refrigerator to dry-brine overnight."},{"recipe_directions":"For compound butter, place butter, shallot, garlic, chives, and the reserved 2 teaspoons steak rub in a small bowl. Mash together with a fork until evenly combined. Spoon butter into a small airtight container, cover, and refrigerate until ready to use."},{"recipe_directions":"Remove steak from the refrigerator 1 hour before cooking to take the chill off. It will cook on the sheet pan that you used for dry-brining."},{"recipe_directions":"Preheat the oven to 300 degrees F (150 degrees C). The reverse sear method is used to cook this big steak, so you will need an instant-read thermometer. If you are using a digital meat thermometer, set the internal temperature to 110 degrees F (43 degrees C)."},{"recipe_directions":"Bake steak on the sheet pan in the preheated oven until an instant-read thermometer inserted into the center reads 110 degrees F (43 degrees C), about 45 minutes. Begin checking the temperature at 30 minutes."},{"recipe_directions":"During the last 15 to 20 minutes of cooking time, preheat an outdoor grill for high heat and lightly oil the grate."},{"recipe_directions":"When steak reaches an internal temperature of  110 degrees F (43 degrees C) measured with an instant-read thermometer, remove it from the oven."},{"recipe_directions":"Grill steak directly on the grates of the preheated grill; sear on both sides, about 2 minutes per side. This is a fatty piece of meat, so be mindful of flame flare-ups. The internal temperature should now read 125 to 135 degrees F (51 to 57 degrees C) for medium rare."},{"recipe_directions":"Remove steak from the grill, and smear compound butter over top. Let butter melt into the steak, heating up the fresh garlic, shallots, and chives. Let steak rest for 10 minutes."},{"recipe_directions":"Slice steak and serve with accumulated juices and melted butter. Be sure to serve the bone–someone will want to gnaw on it!"}]

recipe_directions: [{"recipe_directions":"Preheat an outdoor grill for high heat, and lightly oil the grate. Rub the New York steaks on both sides with the Worcestershire sauce, then season to taste with salt and pepper."},{"recipe_directions":"Cook the steaks on the preheated grill until they are beginning to firm, and are hot and slightly pink in the center, 6 to 7 minutes per side. An instant-read thermometer inserted into the center should read 140 degrees F (60 degrees C). Once the steaks are done, cover them with two layers of aluminum foil, and allow to rest in a warm area for 10 minutes."},{"recipe_directions":"While the steaks are cooking, prepare the cherry sauce by bringing the red wine to a boil in a saucepan over medium-high heat; boil for 5 minutes. Stir in the cherries, sugar, and vanilla extract. Return to a boil, then reduce heat to medium, and simmer until the cherries are tender, 5 to 7 minutes. Dissolve the cornstarch in the water, then stir into the simmering cherry sauce. Cook for a few minutes until the cherry sauce thickens. Pour the sauce over the steaks to serve."}]

Stir to coat."},{"recipe_directions":"Bring rice and 4 cups water to a boil in a saucepan over high heat. recipe_name: Filet Mignon with Bell Pepper Haystack and Fresh Guacamole Served with Corn Chips
recipe_ingredients: [{"recipe_ingredients":"4 small avocados, peeled and mashed"},{"recipe_ingredients":"3  roma (plum) tomatoes, chopped"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 large shallot, minced"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1  jalapeno pepper, minced"},{"recipe_ingredients":"½  lemon, juiced"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 cup low-sodium chicken broth"},{"recipe_ingredients":"¼ cup corn oil"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1  red bell pepper, cut into thin strips"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1  yellow bell pepper, cut into thin strips"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 (4 ounce) package button mushrooms, sliced thin"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 teaspoon coriander seeds, crushed"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 teaspoon celery seed"},{"recipe_ingredients":"¼ teaspoon freshly cracked black pepper"},{"recipe_ingredients":"2 tablespoons water"},{"recipe_ingredients":"3 tablespoons corn oil"},{"recipe_ingredients":"3 large shallots, sliced"},{"recipe_ingredients":"4 cloves garlic, smashed"},{"recipe_ingredients":"3 ½ cups water"},{"recipe_ingredients":"2 tablespoons white wine vinegar"},{"recipe_ingredients":"¼ cup cold unsalted butter, cut into 1/2-inch cubes"},{"recipe_ingredients":"½ teaspoon sea salt"},{"recipe_ingredients":"2 tablespoons olive oil"},{"recipe_ingredients":"4 (6 ounce) beef tenderloin fillets, room temperature"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 (16 ounce) package corn chips"}]
recipe_directions: [{"recipe_directions":"Stir the avocado, roma tomatoes, minced shallot, jalapeno pepper, and lemon juice in a bowl. Chill in refrigerator to allow flavors to meld."},{"recipe_directions":"Place the chicken stock in a small saucepan over medium-low heat; simmer the stock until reduced to about 1/2 cup."},{"recipe_directions":"Heat 1/4 cup corn oil in a skillet over medium heat; cook the red bell pepper and yellow bell pepper in the hot oil until tender, 5 to 7 minutes. Stir the mushrooms into the peppers; season with the coriander seeds, sea salt, and black pepper. Add the reduced chicken stock and the water; cook and stir until the moisture has been absorbed, another 5 to 7 minutes. Transfer the mixture to a plate lined with paper towels to allow the grease to drain."},{"recipe_directions":"Heat the olive oil in a saucepan over medium heat; cook and stir the sliced shallots in the hot oil until softened, about 3 minutes. Stir in the crushed garlic and cook another 3 minutes. Pour 3 1/2 cups water over the mixture and bring to a boil; cook at a boil until the liquid reduces to 1 cup. Strain the mixture through a fine-mesh strainer and return the strained liquid to the saucepan, keeping it over medium heat. Add the white wine vinegar and return to a boil; continue cooking at a boil until the liquid reduced to about 1/4 cup. Quickly whisk in the chilled butter until just melted, whisking constantly. Remove from the heat and keep warm while you prepare the steaks."},{"recipe_directions":"Place a cast-iron skillet over medium-high heat and allow get hot. Heat the oil in the skillet. Cook the steaks in the hot oil until they start to firm, and are reddish-pink and juicy in the center, about 5 minutes per side. An instant-read thermometer inserted into the center should read 130 degrees F (54 degrees C). Cover the meat with two layers of aluminum foil and allow to rest in a warm area for 10 minutes."},{"recipe_directions":"Place a mound of the bell pepper mixture into the center of each serving plate. Slice the rested steaks in half and place atop each mound. Spoon a few spoonfuls of the butter mixture onto the plate to surround the stack. Serve with the chilled guacamole and corn chips."}]

recipe_card: Filet Mignon with Mushrooms
recipe_ingredients: [{"recipe_ingredients":"2 slices bacon"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 ½ tablespoons unsalted butter, divided"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 clove garlic, mashed to a paste"},{"recipe_ingredients":"6  white mushrooms, thinly sliced"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 pinch salt and ground black pepper to taste"},{"recipe_ingredients":"⅓ cup bourbon"},{"recipe_ingredients":"⅓ cup water"},{"recipe_ingredients":"2 tablespoons fresh lemon juice"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 tablespoon Worcestershire sauce"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 tablespoon minced fresh parsley leaves"},{"recipe_ingredients":"2  filet mignon steaks, about 1 inch thick"}]
recipe_directions: [{"recipe_directions":"Place bacon in an 8-inch cast iron skillet and cook over medium-high heat, turning occasionally, until evenly browned, about 10 minutes. Drain bacon slices on paper towels. Pour off excess fat from the skillet. Crumble bacon and reserve."},{"recipe_directions":"Heat 1 tablespoon butter in a skillet over medium-low heat. Cook garlic in the hot butter, stirring, until softened, 1 to 2 minutes. Add mushrooms, salt, and pepper; cook over medium heat, stirring, until liquid from mushrooms starts to evaporate, 5 to 7 minutes. Add bourbon and boil until nearly evaporated. Stir in water, lemon juice, and Worcestershire. Boil until sauce is thickened slightly. Transfer sauce to a small saucepan and stir in reserved bacon and parsley. Keep warm."},{"recipe_directions":"Pat steaks dry with paper towels and sprinkle with salt and pepper."},{"recipe_directions":"Heat remaining butter in a skillet over medium-high heat until foam begins to subside. Sear steaks for 4 minutes; turn over and sear, 3 to 3 1/2 minutes for medium-rare. Divide between 2 plates and spoon sauce over them."}]

recipe_card: Filet Mignon and Balsamic Strawberries 35 Ratings
recipe_ingredients: [{"recipe_ingredients":"2 cups strawberries, sliced"},{"recipe_ingredients":"¼ cup brown sugar"},{"recipe_ingredients":"¼ cup balsamic vinegar"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 tablespoon olive oil"},{"recipe_ingredients":"4 (6 ounce) filet mignon (beef tenderloin)"},{"recipe_ingredients":"salt and pepper to taste"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 tablespoon chilled butter"},{"recipe_ingredients":"freshly ground black pepper to taste"}]
recipe_directions: [{"recipe_directions":"Mix together the strawberries, brown sugar, and balsamic vinegar in a bowl, and allow to sit for 1 to 3 hours, stirring occasionally."},{"recipe_directions":"Preheat an oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C)."},{"recipe_directions":"Heat olive oil in an oven-safe, heavy steel or cast-iron skillet over high heat. Slide the skillet into the preheated oven, and cook until they start to become firm and are reddish-pink and juicy in the center, about 10 minutes. An instant-read thermometer inserted into the center should read 130 degrees F (54 degrees C). Transfer the steaks to a platter, and tent with foil to rest."},{"recipe_directions":"Pour steak juices from the skillet into a small saucepan. Strain the strawberries and discard the liquid. Add the strawberries to the steak juices, bring the sauce to a simmer over medium-low heat, and melt the butter into the sauce, tilting the pan several times to gently incorporate the butter into the sauce. Serve each fillet topped with about 1/2 cup of strawberries and a sprinkle of freshly ground black pepper."}]

recipe_card: Crab-Stuffed Filet Mignon with Whiskey Peppercorn Sauce 317 Ratings
recipe_name: Crab-Stuffed Filet Mignon with Whiskey Peppercorn Sauce
recipe_ingredients: [{"recipe_ingredients":"2 tablespoons olive oil"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 teaspoon minced onion"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 teaspoon minced green onion"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 teaspoon minced garlic"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 teaspoon minced celery"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 teaspoon minced green bell pepper"},{"recipe_ingredients":"2 tablespoons shrimp stock or water"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 (6 ounce) can crab meat, drained"},{"recipe_ingredients":"2 tablespoons bread crumbs"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 teaspoon Cajun seasoning"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 ¼ cups beef broth"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 teaspoon cracked black pepper"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 fluid ounce whiskey"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 cup heavy cream"},{"recipe_ingredients":"4 (6 ounce) filet mignon steaks"},{"recipe_ingredients":"4 slices bacon, cooked lightly"},{"recipe_ingredients":"salt and cracked black pepper to taste"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 tablespoon olive oil"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 clove garlic, minced"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 teaspoon minced shallot"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 cup crimini mushrooms, sliced"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 fluid ounce whiskey"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 teaspoon Dijon mustard"}]
recipe_directions: [{"recipe_directions":"Make Crab Stuffing: Heat 2 tablespoons olive oil in a large skillet. Saute onion, green onion, garlic, celery, and green pepper until tender. Stir in shrimp stock, crab meat, bread crumbs, and Cajun seasoning. Remove from heat, and set aside."},{"recipe_directions":"Prepare Peppercorn Sauce: In a small saucepan over medium heat, combine beef broth and cracked black pepper. Simmer until reduced to 1 cup, stirring frequently. Add 1 ounce whiskey and cream. Continue simmering until reduced to 1 cup. Remove from heat, and set aside."},{"recipe_directions":"Prepare Steaks: Slice a pocket into the side of each steak, and stuff generously with crab stuffing. Wrap bacon around the side, and secure with toothpicks. Season to taste with salt and pepper; set aside. Heat olive oil in a large cast iron skillet over medium heat. Saute garlic and shallot for 1 minute. Stir in mushrooms, and saute until tender. Remove mushroom mixture, and set aside."},{"recipe_directions":"Place steaks in skillet, and cook to desired doneness. Remove from skillet, and keep warm. Deglaze skillet with 1 ounce whiskey. Reduce heat, and stir in peppercorn sauce and Dijon mustard. Add mushroom mixture, and reduce sauce until thickened. Remove toothpicks and bacon from steaks, and arrange steaks on a plate. Top with sauce."}]

Grease a glass baking dish."},{"recipe_directions":"Lay out the flank steak flat in front of you with the grain of the meat running from left to right. Roll the flank steak up and away from you, so that when the roll is cut into the pinwheel shape, each of the filling ingredients can be seen. Roll firmly, but be careful not to squeeze the fillings out the ends. Stir in onion, green peppers, stewed tomatoes, soy sauce, sugar, and salt."},{"recipe_directions":"Cover, and cook on High for 3 to 4 hours, or on Low for 6 to 8 hours."}]

recipe_card: Cast Iron Pan-Seared Steak (Oven-Finished) 59 Ratings
recipe_ingredients: [{"recipe_ingredients":"2 (6 ounce) beef top sirloin steaks"},{"recipe_ingredients":"2 cups orange juice"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 cup apple cider vinegar"},{"recipe_ingredients":"½ cup Worcestershire sauce"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 ½ tablespoons steak seasoning (such as Fiesta Brand® Uncle Chris'), or to taste"},{"recipe_ingredients":"freshly ground black pepper to taste"},{"recipe_ingredients":"2 teaspoons olive oil"},{"recipe_ingredients":"sea salt to taste"}]
recipe_directions: [{"recipe_directions":"Gather all ingredients."},{"recipe_directions":"Dotdash Meredith Food Studios"},{"recipe_directions":"Place steaks side by side in large casserole dish. Add orange juice, cider vinegar, and Worcestershire sauce."},{"recipe_directions":"Dotdash Meredith Food Studios"},{"recipe_directions":"Marinate, uncovered, in the refrigerator for 45 minutes."},{"recipe_directions":"Preheat the oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C)."},{"recipe_directions":"Remove casserole dish from refrigerator. Cover steaks with plastic wrap and let allow to come to room temperature, at least 15 minutes."},{"recipe_directions":"Place steaks on a clean work surface and generously rub with steak seasoning and black pepper."},{"recipe_directions":"Dotdash Meredith Food Studios"},{"recipe_directions":"Heat olive oil in a cast-iron skillet over high heat."},{"recipe_directions":"Cook steaks in the hot skillet until lightly browned on the bottom, 2 1/2 minutes."},{"recipe_directions":"Dotdash Meredith Food Studios"},{"recipe_directions":"Flip and cook until browned on the other side and red in the center, about 2 minutes more."},{"recipe_directions":"Transfer skillet with the steaks to the oven."},{"recipe_directions":"Bake in the preheated oven until steaks are firm and reddish-pink to lightly pink in the center, 8 to 10 minutes. An instant-read thermometer inserted into the center should read from 130 degrees F (54 degrees C) to 140 degrees F (60 degrees C)."},{"recipe_directions":"Remove steaks from oven; season with salt. Let rest for 5 minutes before serving."},{"recipe_directions":"Dotdash Meredith Food Studios"},{"recipe_directions":"Enjoy!"},{"recipe_directions":"DOTDASH MEREDITH FOOD STUDIOS"}]
